{"step_by_step_thinking": "Active management of the third stage of labour is a set of interventions designed to prevent postpartum haemorrhage. According to the documents, it includes the use of an oxytocic drug, early cord clamping and cutting, and controlled cord traction. Misoprostol is a uterotonic drug that can be used to prevent postpartum haemorrhage, but it is not a part of the standard active management of the third stage of labour.", "answer_choice": "D"}
